items.title: Tata Steel to buy 50% in Thriveni Pellets for ₹636cr
items.summary:
- **Tata Steel** to acquire just over 50% of **Thriveni Pellets** for ₹636 crore, securing a strategic pellet facility in **Odisha**. 
- **Thriveni Pellets** runs a 4‑million‑ton pellet plant at **Jajpur** and a 212‑km slurry pipeline; the remaining 49.99% is held by **Lloyds Metals & Energy**. 
- In FY25, **Thriveni Pellets** posted ₹45 crore profit on ₹2,479 crore revenue, while Tata Steel also aims to explore a **6‑million‑ton** steel plant with **Lloyds** in Gadchiroli.

items.title: Thyssenkrupp to shut GOES sites; 1,200 jobs at risk
items.summary:
- TKSE will temporarily shut its GOES plants in Europe, risking about *1,200 jobs*.
- The move follows deeper cuts across TKSE, with talks of a sale to *Jindal Steel International* and roughly *11,000 jobs* already being trimmed.
- *GOES* imports have surged, aided by US tariffs that redirected supply to Europe, raising concerns over fair competition.

items.title: Manufacturing to contribute 25% of GDP by 2047
items.summary:
- India aims to raise manufacturing's share to **25% of GDP by 2047**, per a joint BCG and Z47 report. 
- Growth is driven by flagship programs like *Make in India*, *Atmanirbhar Bharat*, and **PLI schemes** across sectors such as *electronics*, *defence*, *automotive & EV*, *energy*, and pharmaceuticals. 
- The transformation rests on pillars of **innovation**, **strategic depth**, **competitiveness**, and **technology adoption**, plus regional clusters (Noida-Chennai-Hosur, Dholera).

items.title: Jindal Steel expands heat-treatment capacity in India
items.summary:
- Jindal Steel has expanded to become India's largest heat‑treatment producer, reaching 60,000 tons/month with *FN* and *Q&T* plates up to 200 mm thick.
- The plant uses *DUBONG* technology for precise temperature control, enabling high‑strength *Q&T*, *abrasion‑resistant*, and *defence‑grade* steels.
- The expansion strengthens domestic manufacturing under *Atmanirbhar Bharat*, reducing imports and boosting export capability across infrastructure, energy, and heavy industries.

items.title: Manufacturing to contribute 25% of GDP by 2047: Report
items.summary:
- A joint **BCG** and Z47 report forecasts India's manufacturing share rising to 25% of GDP by 2047, aided by *Make in India* and *PLI* schemes.
- Five anchor sectors—**electronics**, **defence**, **automotive/EV**, **energy**, and **pharmaceuticals**—could unlock a $25 trillion industrial opportunity by 2047.
- Regional corridors like *Noida-Chennai-Hosur* and *Dholera* are highlighted to co-locate suppliers, cut costs, and accelerate innovation with a strong policy and investment runway.

items.title: JCB India unveils 52-tonne excavator at Excon 2025
items.summary: - JCB India unveiled a *52-tonne excavator*, the largest manufactured in India, for domestic and export markets at *Excon 2025*. - The launch includes more than 10 new products (enhanced backhoe loaders, a 2–5 tonne excavator range) and industry-first tech such as *Parts Online* and next-gen *telematics*. - JCB highlighted sustainability with a growing *hydrogen portfolio* (hydrogen engine backhoe loader and a hydrogen genset), plus 45% fuel-efficiency gains and exports to 135+ countries.

items.title: Cyient acquires ADGCE to expand in Middle East
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- Cyient announced it acquired Abu Dhabi & Gulf Computer Est. (ADGCE), expanding its footprint in the *Middle East*. 
- The deal targets energy, utilities, transportation and connectivity, delivering localised, future-ready solutions with **IoT** and **digital transformation** and asset-management capabilities. 
- The expansion aligns with Saudi Vision 2030 and UAE Vision 2031, tapping a regional energy investment and enabling closer collaboration with governments and utilities.

items.title: Huge potential for collaboration between India and US in healthcare: Dr Naresh Trehan
China pledges to maintain fiscal stimulus to support growth next year
Germany, France, Spain move to end FCAS deadlock
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- **FCAS** is a €100 billion programme at risk as *Germany*, *France*, and *Spain* hold talks to end the deadlock.
- Disagreements between *Dassault Aviation* and *Airbus* over leadership, plus IG Metall warnings, threaten progress.
- A senior German lawmaker urged focusing on the *Combat Cloud* and unmanned systems to salvage FCAS, possibly letting each country pursue its own jet.

items.title: US phone imports from Samsung hub Vietnam hit lowest level since 2020
items.summary:
- US imports of phones and parts from Vietnam fell to their lowest in over five years in November, as *Samsung Electronics* faced *trade uncertainties* and weak demand. 
- Exports rose earlier but shipments slumped after the 20% tariffs in August despite exemptions, weighing on Vietnam's smartphone trade. 
- November totals show Vietnam's phone exports to the US fell to under $410 million, with total exports around $4 billion as Samsung dominates but does not disclose Vietnam figures.

items.title: Glenmark Pharmaceuticals launches generic anemia medication in US market
Prada to roll out $930 ‘Made in India’ sandals crafted with desi artisans after backlash
India secures $135 billion in FDI commitments in 2025 amid global investment surge
CP Plus targets large enterprises with AI cameras
items.summary:
- *CP Plus* aims to make its full camera portfolio **AI-enabled** and expand into retail, manufacturing, and oil & gas for preventive security.
- It partnered with *Qualcomm Technologies* to launch on-device AI video security solutions for public safety and industrial use.
- The company says about 25% of products already have analytics, aiming for 50% and then 100%, with on-premise data storage and regulatory compliance.

items.title: New labelling rule for clothes and home textiles
items.author: Kirtika Suneja, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- **India** to introduce mandatory labelling for fibre content, origin and care instructions on apparel and home textiles. 
- The rule aims to align with **global practices**, aid recycling and curb **misleading claims** on fibre and origin. 
- The textile ministry plans to boost **recycled-material use** in government procurement and study waste streams.

India to build fully indigenous HPC by 2030
items.summary:
- **India** aims for full *indigenisation* of high-performance computing by **2030**, with products due by 2032.
- Indigenous content in HPC is already ~50% and could exceed 70% by decade's end, per ISM chief *Amitesh Kumar Sinha*.
- NSM 2.0 roadmap targets exascale computing and indigenous CPU, GPU, and AI accelerators to strengthen the ecosystem.

items.title: RBI may maintain repo rate at 5.25% through FY27: Fitch
items.summary: - *BMI*, **Fitch Solutions**, expects RBI to hold the policy repo rate at 5.25% through FY27 after a 25bp cut earlier this month.\n- *rupee* is forecast to trade near INR 90/USD by month-end and around INR 90.5/USD in 2026.\n- The RBI's outlook shows *inflation* easing (CPI near 0.6% in December and 2.9% in Q4) with FY26 *GDP* at 7.3%.

items.title: India slams China-led investment plan at WTO
ReNew Power to raise $800 million to refinance debt
Petronet LNG secures ₹12,000 crore loan for petrochem project
items.summary:
- Petronet LNG has secured a ₹12,000-crore term loan from **State Bank of India** and **Bank of Baroda** to fund its petrochemicals project.
- Each lender sanctioned ₹6,000 crore under the facility after a competitive bidding process advised by SBI Capital Markets.
- Petronet LNG, a JV of **GAIL**, **ONGC**, Indian Oil and **BPCL** with 12.5% stake each, runs LNG terminals at Dahej and Kochi with a capacity of 22.5 MTPA.

items.title: Uttar Pradesh clears green hydrogen centres of excellence at IIT-BHU and MMMUT
PHWR makers may build key parts for small modular reactors
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Indian PHWR manufacturers are poised to participate in making critical equipment for **Small Modular Reactors (SMRs)**, per Lok Sabha briefing.
- Localization under the **Make in India** initiative, with technical handholding by *BARC*, aims to build a complete domestic manufacturing and supply chain.
- Private sector will engage in *EPC* contracts for SMRs, creating a domestic ecosystem and potential overseas opportunities as other countries plan deployment.

items.title: India’s logistics costs have come down to 9%, says Nitin Gadkari
Lloyds Metals & Tata Steel sign MoU for collaboration
items.summary:
- Lloyds Metals and Tata Steel signed a non-binding *MoU* to explore cooperation in mining, logistics, pellet production and steelmaking in India.
- The *MoU* covers greenfield steel projects, iron ore mining, slurry pipeline infrastructure, pellet production, direct reduced iron and exports of low-carbon iron and steel products, with detailed evaluation and approvals.
- The signing was by Lloyds Metals MD B. Prabhakaran and Tata Steel CEO T. V. Narendran, focusing on opportunities in *Gadchiroli* district, *Maharashtra*.

items.title: Enlight Metals enters chemical trading with TradeHub
items.summary:
- *Enlight Metals has launched Enlight TradeHub Pvt. Ltd to trade solvents, acids and speciality intermediates, expanding into the chemical trading market in India and Asia.*
- *The venture leverages Enlight Metals' procurement and logistics network to broaden raw-material access and enable cross-selling across customers.*
- *Sustainability plans include low-emission feedstocks and bio-based alternatives, with recyclable industrial cleaners slated for mid-2026, supporting circular supply chains.*

items.title: Sanlayan Group’s Versabyte technology among DRDO innovations handed over to Armed Forces
Cipla launches Yurpeak for obesity and type 2 diabetes
items.summary: - Cipla introduced *Yurpeak* (tirzepatide), a once-weekly injectable therapy for obesity and *type 2 diabetes* under a Lilly collaboration.\n- It will be offered in six strengths (2.5–15 mg) via the KwikPen, priced to match Lilly’s *Mounjaro* and distributed nationwide in India.\n- The rollout includes patient education programs to support dosing and safe use, signaling a broadened access strategy for Cipla’s chronic‑disease portfolio.

items.title: Virtusa acquires SmartSoC to expand into semiconductors
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - *SmartSoC Solutions* is acquired by Virtusa to add **semiconductor engineering** and IC design capabilities to its portfolio.\n- The deal expands Virtusa’s full-stack delivery from silicon to cloud, adding 1,400+ engineers in **VLSI**, physical design, and embedded software.\n- CEO Nitesh Banga says the move positions Virtusa in **semiconductor engineering** to support AI and data-center growth.

items.title: ACE and Sanghvi Movers to boost homegrown cranes
items.summary: - ACE and Sanghvi Movers signed a strategic MOU to deploy indigenously manufactured heavy cranes across India's infrastructure and industrial projects.\n- The partnership backs Make in India and Aatmanirbhar Bharat, boosting domestic supply chains, employment and skill development.\n- ACE provides product support, customization and tech solutions while Sanghvi Movers expands its Indian-made crane fleet to reduce imports and improve efficiency.

items.title: HCLTech ties up with Dolphin Semiconductor to co-develop energy-efficient chips
Waaree hits 1 GW monthly solar module milestone
items.summary:
- **Waaree Energies** produced over *1 GW* of solar modules in November 2025, becoming India's first manufacturer to hit this monthly milestone.
- The company's capacity now stands at **19.7 GW in India** and **2.6 GW in the United States**, totaling **22.3 GW** globally, backed by automated and vertically integrated facilities.
- The milestone highlights the growing role of domestic production in meeting solar demand and supports India's *renewable energy targets* and export prospects.

items.title: Smart Joules raises $10 mn in Series B funding to expand energy-efficiency, cooling operations
Trontek enters residential storage market with Powercube systems
items.summary:
- Trontek launches **Powercube** residential storage (1.4 kWh and 2.7 kWh) using **LiFePO4** chemistry for grid backup and hybrid solar, marking a shift from OEM to direct-to-home energy solutions. 
- Standard and Premium variants add features such as an **SOC indicator** or LED display, and target regions with high *rooftop solar* adoption and rising residential demand. 
- Trontek will support distribution through its channel network and run consumer education programs on lithium-ion storage to extend lifecycle beyond lead-acid options.

items.title: Thermax eyes global leadership, charts strategy for bold transformation in energy transition
LTTS and PALFINGER open Pune Global Development Centre
items.author: ETEnterpriseAI Desk
items.summary:
- LTTS and PALFINGER inaugurated a **Global Development Centre (GDC)** in Pune as part of a multi-year engineering and digital services partnership.
- The GDC will work on **embedded software**, PLM migration, CAE simulations and digital mock-ups, with AI-powered workflows to speed product development.
- The initiative supports PALFINGER's localisation and digital transformation across the **APAC region**, reinforcing LTTS as a strategic innovation hub.

items.title: KETO Motors to invest ₹300cr in Jadcherla EV plant
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- **KETO Motors** signed an MoU with Telangana to set up an electric bus facility at Jadcherla with a ₹300 crore investment.
- The plant will produce **9-metre electric buses** for domestic and international markets, creating over 2,000 direct jobs in three years.
- The project uses **TG-iPASS** for single-window clearances and strengthens Telangana’s clean mobility and domestic EV value chain.

items.title: Labour ministry, Microsoft sign MoU to expand AI-led skilling and global job linkages
PM Modi meets Nadella, Intel’s Lip-Bu Tan and Cognizant chief as tech giants firm up India bets
MaxVolt Energy expands battery plants with new Duhai unit
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary: - *MaxVolt Energy* expands its domestic footprint with a *55,000 sq ft* facility in the *Duhai Industrial Area* to ramp up *battery production* for mobility, solar and industrial uses.\n- The plant upgrades automation to lift annual output from 72,000 to about 225,000 units.\n- Government subsidies and incentives support the expansion, underscoring India's push for local storage solutions and a larger domestic supply chain.

items.title: Sterling E-Mobility to make systems core of business, targets 70% share by FY28
Sumadhura signs ₹600-cr MoU for 100-acre park in Telangana
items.summary:
- Sumadhura Group signed an MoU with *Telangana* to develop a *100-acre* **Grade A+ industrial and warehousing park** with an investment of **₹600 crore** over two years.
- The project, announced at the *Telangana Rising Global Summit 2025*, aims to attract high-value industries and create around *8,000 direct jobs*, boosting *economic impact* and supporting Telangana's goal of a $3 trillion economy by 2047.
- The park will feature *modular plug-and-play units*, *green development standards*, and a *next-generation industrial ecosystem* to serve sectors like *aerospace*, *automotive*, *pharmaceutical*, and *e-commerce*.
